intro: Stachys barbata, commonly known as hedge nettle, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring square stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale purple to pink flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its hairy leaves and stems are characteristic of the mint family (Lamiaceae), and it is often found in disturbed soils along roadsides and in meadows. Stachys barbata is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
